titleStmt.title: A sermon preached in Christ-Church before His Excellency the lord deputy and the honorable House of Peers, October the 8th, 1695 being the day appointed for a solemn thanksgiving for the taking the strong cittadel of Namur, and for the other happy successes of His Majesty's forces, and those of his allies in Flanders this campaign / by Edward, Lord Bishop of Down & Connor.
titleStmt.author: Walkington, Edward.

titleStmt.title: A sermon preached in Christ-Church before His Excellency the lord deputy and the honorable House of Peers, October the 8th, 1695 being the day appointed for a solemn thanksgiving for the taking the strong cittadel of Namur, and for the other happy successes of His Majesty's forces, and those of his allies in Flanders this campaign / by Edward, Lord Bishop of Down & Connor.
titleStmt.author: Walkington, Edward.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for William Norman, Eliphal Dobson, and Patrick Campbell, booksellers,

notesStmt.note: "Thursday, the 10th of October, 1695. By the Lords Spiritual and Temporal in Parliament assembled. Ordered, that the Earl of Droghedah ... be desired to cause his sermon to be printed. Gerard Bor. cler. Parliamentor."--T.p. verso.
Reproduction of original in the Cambridge University Library.
